summary: The 'Patients Before Middlemen Act' aims to improve pharmacy access and transparency within Medicare Part D plans. Key provisions include: ensuring any willing pharmacy can participate in networks; establishing standards for contract terms between plans and pharmacies; requiring reports on pharmacy reimbursement trends within essential retail pharmacies (those serving underserved areas); allowing pharmacies to report violations of contract terms; ensuring pharmacy benefit managers (PBMs) operate transparently, disclose information to sponsors and the government, and adhere to specific requirements regarding remuneration. This bill also addresses accountability of PBMs.
